message_1:
A math student was given the following premises: 

1. Alice has 5 apples and Bob has 3 apples.
2. If Alice gives Bob 2 apples, then Alice will have 3 apples and Bob will have 5 apples.

Using linear logic, how many apples will each person have if Alice gives Bob 1 apple?
message_2: If Alice gives Bob 1 apple, she will have 4 apples (5 - 1) and Bob will have 4 apples (3 + 1).
